meanings.definition: The condition or quality of being postmodern.
meanings.sent1: The postmodernities of the art world challenge traditional norms.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often study different postmodernities in literature and architecture.
meanings.sent3: The postmodernities of fashion can sometimes be confusing but always interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a canvas of postmodernities, blending past and present seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The postmodernities of technology continue to evolve rapidly.

meanings.definition: The ideas, practices, and styles associated with postmodernism.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the postmodernities of music requires an open mind.
meanings.sent2: Artists in the 21st century often draw inspiration from various postmodernities.
meanings.sent3: The postmodernities of cooking can lead to delicious and unexpected dishes.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a tapestry of postmodernities, weaving together diverse influences.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the postmodernities of film can be a fascinating journey.

meanings.definition: The state or period of time characterized by postmodernism.
meanings.sent1: The postmodernities of the 21st century challenge traditional beliefs.
meanings.sent2: Literature from the postmodernities often plays with narrative structure.
meanings.sent3: In the postmodernities of social media, trends come and go quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a reflection of postmodernities, mixing vintage and modern decor.
meanings.sent5: The postmodernities of politics can be unpredictable and complex.
